items.sentence: Doing that was harder than I thought it'd be.
Tom lied when he told Mary he'd won the race.
Is it true Tom can't see out of his left eye?
Tom told Mary he was going to try to do that.
Tom told Mary he was going to give her a car.
Not enough salt is better than too much salt.
Tom didn't want to go to school this morning.
You could've chosen an easier way to do that.
Tom was clutching something in his left hand.
Tom asked his friend for the loan of his car.
